Key Match Events: The Cubs rallied for the tying and go-ahead runs in a five-run eighth inning, when the Los Angeles Dodgers committed three errors.
Center fielder Pete Crow-Armstrong robbed Max Muncy of a potential two-run homer with two outs in the ninth.
Los Angeles Dodgers’ Tommy Edman hit two home runs on two pitches from Imanaga for a 2-1 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Cubs manager Craig Counsell said that the matchup of Japanese star pitchers Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Shota Imanaga was "pretty cool."
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs manager Craig Counsell said "We’ve played wonderful defense this series."
Dodgers' Muncy said "It was a frustrating way to lose that game. We made a lot of mental mistakes. We got to eliminate that."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured a matchup of Japanese star pitchers Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Shota Imanaga.
Shohei Ohtani remains four homers and three stolen bases from becoming the first player in major league history to achieve a 50-50 season.
Others: Los Angeles’ division lead was cut to 4 1/2 games over second-place San Diego.
Chicago is four games back of Atlanta and the New York Mets, who are tied for the last NL wild card.
